questions.text: A 34-year-old man presents to the fertility clinic for evaluation of infertility. He and his wife have been trying to have children for two years. His wife was recently evaluated and found to be normal and healthy. The patient denies any pain in his testicular region. However, he reports occasional feelings of heaviness in his scrotum. On physical exam, his scrotum looks distended. At rest, a "bag of worm"-like finding is visible and palpable in the testicle. What is the grade of the given condition?
questions.explanation:
Correct Option C - Grade III:

Varicocele Grading

  

Grade 1

Palpable during Valsalva maneuver, but not otherwise

Grade 2

Palpable at rest but not visible

Grade 3

Visible and palpable at rest

Diagnosis

Diagnosis is based on a combination of physical examination and imaging tests, such as scrotal ultrasound, to assess the size and location of the varicocele.

Grading

Varicoceles can be graded based on their size and palpability:
 
  • Grade 0: No palpable or visible varicocele.
 
  • Grade 1: Palpable with Valsalva maneuver, not visible in standing position.
 
  • Grade 2: Palpable and visible in standing position.
 
  • Grade 3: Large and easily visible without Valsalva maneuver.

Management

Treatment may be considered for symptomatic varicoceles or those affecting fertility. Conservative measures include scrotal support and pain management. Surgical procedures, such as varicocelectomy or embolization, may be performed to correct the varicocele and improve fertility in select cases.

Complications

Varicoceles are generally benign, but they can be associated with male infertility due to increased scrotal temperature, altered testicular blood flow, and potential negative effects on sperm quality. In some cases, they may cause testicular atrophy (shrinkage) and chronic testicular pain (rare).

questions.text: A 60-year-old patient with a history of open-angle glaucoma is prescribed various antiglaucoma medications to manage intraocular pressure. Which of the following antiglaucoma drugs are wrongly matched with their mechanism of action?
questions.correct_answer: D. Alpha agonists – Increase trabecular outflow
questions.explanation:
Correct Option D - Alpha agonists - Increase trabecular ou

Drug Class

Mechanism of Action

Beta-Blockers

Reduces aqueous humor production by blocking beta-adrenergic receptors in the ciliary body. Eg – Timolol, betaxolol, levobunolol.

Alpha Agonists

Dual function - Increases Uveoscleral outflow and decreases aqueous humor production. Eg – adrenaline, dipivefrin, brimonidine.

Miotic Agents

Increases trabecular outflow and opens the angle blockage by constricting the pupil and stretching the trabecular meshwork. E.g. – Pilocarpine.

Prostaglandin analogues

Increases uveoscleral outflow of aqueous humor. Eg – Latanoprost, Bimatoprost, and Travoprost

Carbonic Anhydrase inhibitors

Reduces aqueous humor production . Eg – Dorzolamide, and brinzolamide.

Rho-Kinase inhibitors

Increases trabecular outflow by increasing the contractile property of the trabecular meshwork and also decreases the aqueous production. Eg – Netarsudil.

questions.text: A 32-year-old female named Sarah recently survived a severe car accident. She was trapped in the wreckage for several hours before being rescued. questions.explanation:
Correct Option C : Hypervigilance and avoidance behavior.

Post traumatic stress disorder

Definition

Stress disorder occurring after exposure to actual or threatened death, serious injury, or sexual violence. Symptoms last more than a month.

Symptoms

MAHI: Mood and cognitive symptoms, Avoidance, Hyperarousal, Intrusion symptoms.

Delayed Expression

Symptoms may appear after 6 months of trauma.

Structural Changes

PTSD is associated with structural changes in the Hippocampus and Amygdala.

Risk Factors

Female gender, Childhood trauma, Poor social support, Stressful life changes, Family history of psychiatric illness, Certain personality disorder traits.

Treatment

Pharmacotherapy (SSRIs), Psychotherapy (CBT, EMDR).

Complex PTSD

New diagnosis in ICD 11, associated with repetitive and severe stressors. Additional symptoms include affect regulation problems and difficulties in relationships.

Additionally, her serum lipid profile shows decreased levels of eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA). Which of the following is a source of eicosapentaenoic acid?
questions.explanation:
Correct Option B - Fish

  • Linoleic acid, Arachidonic acid
  • Safflower oil
  • Linolenic acid
  • Flaxseed oil, soybean oil
  • Eicosa pentatonic acid
  • Fish oil

questions.text: A 9-year-old child is exhibiting symptoms of inattention, hyperactivity, and impulsivity. The symptoms have been present for the past 8 months and are observed both at school and at home. The parents are seeking advice regarding the most appropriate medication for their child. The child does not have any known cardiac issues, and the family history is negative for cardiac problems. What is the drug of choice for the patient in this case?
questions.explanation:
Correct Option B - Methylphenidate (ADHD)

Treatment Options

Description

Pharmacotherapy
  • First-line treatment
    • CNS Stimulants: Methylphenidate (drug of choice), Amphetamine, Modafinil
    • Non-stimulants: Atomoxetine, α-2 agonists (e.g., clonidine, guanfacine), Bupropion

Psychosocial Interventions
  • Psychoeducation of parents
  • Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT) 
  • Behavior therapy
  • Social skills training
  • Group therapy

questions.text: Forty-five years old women experience lower abdominal pain and foul-smelling vaginal discharge. Which of the following is INCORRECT for the clinical presentation of a patient with puerperal fever?

options.label: B
options.text: Most persistent fevers after childbirth are caused by genital tract infection.

options.label: C
options.text: Breast engorgement can be a cause of fever in puerperium

options.label: D
options.text: Occurrence of puerperal mastitis requires abandoning breast feeding

questions.correct_answer: D. Occurrence of puerperal mastitis requires abandoning breast feeding

A 51-year-old patient visits the clinic again, expressing gastric irritation and diarrhea, despite recurrent duodenal ulcers and multiple treatments. After a secretin stimulation test shows elevated serum gastrin levels, which medication would the doctor prescribe to manage this condition?

A 32-year-old female has been experiencing muscle twitches in her left eyelid and cheek for two days . She previously had a similar episode three months ago and has been experiencing weakness, making it difficult to lift weights during her gym sessions for the past two months. A neurological exam revealed a Babinski sign and an electric shock sensation when flexing her neck . Her cerebrospinal fluid analysis showed elevated protein levels (110 mg/dl) and presence of oligoclonal bands , with all other parameters normal. What drug is effective in reducing the frequency of attacks for her condition?
questions.explanation: Correct Option C - Natalizu

questions.text: Identify the procedure shown below that can be performed for a 40-year-old female with toxic nodular goiter.
questions.explanation: Correct Option C - Total Th

questions.text: A 5-month-old baby has been declared dead on arrival. The parents claim that the baby was found breathless and unresponsive in the morning when the mother had tried to wake him up for breastfeeding . The baby had been healthy and had not shown signs of any discomfort or disease. Which statement among the following, is not true about this condition??

options.label: D
options.text: Cigarette smoking by pregnant mothers increase the risk

questions.explanation: Correct Option C - Incidence
